items.title: Nykaa Q2 Preview: Strong festive demand and margin gains to lift earnings
items.description: Nykaa is expected to post strong Q2FY26 results with 25–27% YoY revenue growth, led by festive demand, robust beauty segment performance, and improving fashion margins. Analysts see EBITDA margin expansion and a sharp profit surge driven by premiumisation, cost control, and improved operating leverage.

items.title: Bajaj Auto Q2 Preview: PAT may rise 16% YoY as exports and premium mix drive gains
items.description: Bajaj Auto is poised for a strong Q2FY26, with PAT projected to rise 16% year-on-year. This growth is fueled by a significant export recovery, particularly in Africa and Latin America, alongside a richer product mix and favorable currency movements. Despite subdued domestic demand, premium motorcycles and three-wheelers are expected to bolster margins and drive double-digit revenue growth.

items.title: Ola Electric Q2 Results: Cons loss narrows to Rs 418 crore YoY, revenue plunges 43%
items.description: Ola Electric Q2 Results:  Ola Electric Mobility reported a narrowed consolidated loss of Rs 418 crore in Q2 FY26, an improvement from Rs 495 crore in the prior year. However, its consolidated revenue from operations saw a significant 43% year-on-year decline, falling to Rs 690 crore from Rs 1,214 crore in Q2 FY25.
